CrazyChess.logic

Class BasicValidityChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • CrazyChess.logic.BasicValidityChecker

  • public class BasicValidityChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    This class performs some basic checks to see if a move on the board is at least somewhat valid. i.e. doesn't go through other pieces, doesn't go off the board

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BasicValidityChecker()

    • Method Detail

      • moveCheckAssigner

        public boolean moveCheckAssigner(AbstractPiece p,
                                 int xRel,
                                 int yRel,
                                 boolean isDebug,
                                 AbstractPiece[][] gamestate,
                                 int moveNo)
        A method that checks what validity checker method to use for the piece
        Parameters:
        p - input piece that is being checked
        xRel - the relative x movement from the piece
        yRel - the relative y movement from the piece
        isDebug - is debug mode active
        gamestate - current game state
        moveNo - current move number
        Returns:
        true if valid move, false if not

      • columnAndRowCheck

        public Position columnAndRowCheck(int x,
                                  int y,
                                  java.lang.String dir,
                                  AbstractPiece p,
                                  Position newPos,
                                  boolean isDebug,
                                  AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        Return furthest possible tile if moving in a column or row. Further used when checking possible moves of rooks and queens
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the checked position
        y - y coordinate of the checked position
        dir - string representing direction: up, down, left, or right
        p - initial piece being checked, doesn't change, just used
        newPos - the new Position
        isDebug - is debug mode activated
        gamestate - the current game state
        Returns:
        the position of either end of check or right place

      • diagonalCheck

        public Position diagonalCheck(int x,
                              int y,
                              java.lang.String dir,
                              AbstractPiece p,
                              Position newPos,
                              boolean isDebug,
                              AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        Returns furthest possible diagonal placement. Further used for bishops ands queens
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the checked position
        y - y coordinate of the checked position
        dir - diagonal directions as strings
        p - initial piece being checked, doesn't change, just used
        newPos - the new Position
        isDebug - is debug mode activated
        gamestate - the current game state
        Returns:
        the position of either end of check or right place

      • validityCheckPawn

        public boolean validityCheckPawn(Pawn p,
                                 int xRel,
                                 int yRel,
                                 boolean isDebug,
                                 AbstractPiece[][] gamestate,
                                 int turnNo)
        Checking movement validity for pawns.
        Parameters:
        p - the piece to be checked
        xRel - the relative x movement from the piece
        yRel - the relative y movement from the piece
        isDebug - is debug mode activated
        gamestate - the current game state
        turnNo - number of the current turn
        Returns:
        true if move is okay, false if not

      • validityCheckRook

        public boolean validityCheckRook(Rook p,
                                 int xRel,
                                 int yRel,
                                 boolean isDebug,
                                 AbstractPiece[][] gamestate)
        Checks if Rook's move is legal. Checks all legal tiles that the rook can move to and then checks if the candidate position is among them.
        Parameters:
        p - the piece to be checked
        xRel - the relative x movement from the piece
        yRel - the relative y movement from the piece
        isDebug - is debug mode activated
        gamestate - the current game state
        Returns:
        true if move is okay
